snippet: In its earnings report, the bank said discussions over penalties show “a high degree of uncertainty” as to the amount the United States might impose.
abstract: BNP Paribas warns it may have to pay penalties higher than the $1.1 billion it had set aside for investigation by American authorities into whether it processed payments for countries facing United States sanctions.
lead_paragraph: In its earnings report, the bank said discussions over penalties show “a high degree of uncertainty” as to the amount the United States might impose.

headline.main: BNP Paribas Says U.S. Penalties May Top the $1.1 Billion It Set Aside
headline.print_headline: BNP Paribas Says U.S. Penalties May Top the $1.1 Billion It Set Aside
